utterances.translation: The mother was working on a mat sitting on the floor. It was a hot day.
A little boy was beside his mother making arrows.
The mother got thirsty.
She said, “My child, I got thirsty. Please give me a drink.

utterances.transcript: wim̓aaqƛs,        waaʔat     t̓an̓aʔi,   n̓aacsasuuk  ʔan  c̓iiḥatiqiiɬ.
utterances.translation: I can’t. You can see I’m making arrows,” said the son.
“Go, my child! Get me a drink,” she repeated.
“I can’t, I said. I’m working,” the child repeated.

utterances.transcript: ʔuuḥtaasaʔi               t̓een̓a, xaašxiipšiƛcums.            ɬaakcaḥicumʔick    wik̓iituk              ʔumʔiiqsu xaašxiipšiƛquus.
utterances.translation: “Behave my child. I might turn into a blue jay. You might be poor without a mother if I turn into a blue jay.
Go ahead and turn into a blue jay. I don’t care,” the child repeated.
He had just stopped talking.

utterances.transcript: naʔiičiƛ,    xaaš  xaaš  xaaš  xaaš, wawaaʔi.
utterances.translation: Then he heard something saying “_xa:š xa:š xa:š xa:š_”.
He looked up just in time to see a blue jay flying up.
He ran to get the pail right away.

utterances.transcript: wiiksas      ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa,          wawaaqčik              kamatqukqčik                  ʔucačiƛ      č̓aʔakʔi.
utterances.translation: “I didn’t really mean it,” he said as he ran towards the river.
He dipped the bucket in and ran back home.

utterances.transcript: nicwiiʔap              kacutum ƛawaʔii    xaašxiipšiƛ̓i,                     maa   ʔuum naqšiʔi,      wiiksas      ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa,          maa   naqšiʔi,      waa waa.
utterances.translation: He dipped the dipper in, and went near the one that turned into a blue jay and said, “Here mom, have a drink; I didn’t really mean it; here, have a drink.”

utterances.transcript: ʔanasiɬaƛquuč                   xaaš, xaaš, wawaaqčik              kʷiscačiƛ           matšiƛ.
utterances.translation: All she said was “_xa:š_, _xa:š_,” as she flew from one place to another.
The blue jay flew out and up onto a tree.
There it sat, crying “_xa:š_, _xa:š_.”

utterances.transcript: ƛaawuɬšiʔaƛquuč                      maʔiƛqacʔi    ʔanasiɬaƛquuč             kʷiscačiƛ           mataasiƛ          suč̓as.
utterances.translation: Whenever the little boy got close, it would just fly away to another tree.

utterances.transcript: wik wiikʕaƛp̓ičḥ                maʔiƛqacʔi,   maa,  ʔuum naqšiʔi,      wawaa ʕiiḥp̓ičḥ.
utterances.translation: The little boy did not stop and kept saying while crying, “Here, mom, have a drink.”

utterances.transcript: huḥtakšiƛ    maʔiƛqacʔi    ʔan  ʔaanaqḥ    xaašxiipšiƛuk             ʔumʔiiqsu.
utterances.translation: The little boy knew now that his mother really turned into a blue jay.

utterances.transcript: t̓iʕiƛ                  ʕiiḥp̓ičḥ,             ʔuu ʔuum, wiiksas      ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa,          wawaa ʕiḥak.
utterances.translation: He sat down and cried; “Oh, mother, I did not really mean it,” he said crying.

utterances.transcript: ʔaanaqḥuk       xaašxiipšiƛ               ʔumʔiiqsu. ʔunw̓iiƛḥ       ʔan  wiiksa   naʔaa qʷiyaatʔitq         ʔaʔumʔat                          naquutiʔis           waaʔat.
utterances.translation: His mother really turned into a blue jay, because he did not listen when he was first asked to get her water to drink.
Lesson — You listen when someone tells you to do something.

utterances.transcript: wik naaw̓aḥi qiip̓atʕaƛ̓atquuk                          ʔan     ʔuušsuuqstuʔaqƛ̓atsuu         ʔayup̓itʕaƛ̓atquu.
utterances.translation: Don’t wait until they have to repeat it to you, because they will get angry at you when they have to keep repeating.
You should do it right away whatever you are asked to do.
